Reviews.Title: “La dolce vita”
Reviews.Author: Helen M
Reviews.Content: The eperience in this hotel was excellent! The personal realy now to do tourism. The receptionists are very willing to help you with the directions (they are printing you maps). The cleaning service is very good. The experience here is one of the cleanest side of ROme. The breakfast is very fresh and consistent, just some vegetables are missing. Congrats guys!

Reviews.Title: “Not in City Centre”
Reviews.Author: GeorginaP161
Reviews.Content: Booked this hotel as a package with EasyJet, was told it was 15 mins walk from City Centre, but this was not correct, was actually 15 mins walk to Metro Station at Camillio. Was too far to walk to the centre of Rome. Hotel was nice and clean, but freezing cold bedroom, no heating. No coffee/tea making facilities. Buffet breakfast had a good selection. Went in Feb 2012 and they had snow. Couldnt have a hot bath, water was tepid. Would not recommend this hotel to any friends or family. It cost 50 euros to get from airport to the hotel in a taxi.

Reviews.Title: “very average”
Reviews.Author: loveducks
Reviews.Content: This hotel is situated about 20-30mins away from the city centre by metro. Again one of those Italian hotels with tiny facilities, such as lifts. Tiny bathroom with bidet and shower. Bedroom is big enough to open up 2 big luggage. Wardrobes with hangers. No coffee/tea making facilities. No English channels available on TV programs. Walking distance to the Metro, about 20mins. This will not be my choice of accommodation if I were to return to Rome again but it's definitely decent and clean enough to stay in.

Reviews.Title: “Not a 4* but still nice”
Reviews.Author: UKTraveller1991
Reviews.Content: My girlfriend and I stayed here for 3 nights in January 2012 and were a bit nervous especially after reading reviews about the hotel and surrounding area. However, we were really pleasantly surprised by what we experienced. The hotel is only a 5-10 minute walk from the Furio Camillio metro station. The area isn't rough or dangerous, it's just not as attractive as the middle of Rome - mainly because it is a residential area. Neither of us ever felt in danger or uneasy, even walking back at 8pm in the darkness. The room was large, with aircon, balcony and a nice clean bathroom. The "double" bed was actually two single mattresses pushed together with one sheet put over the top but it never really caused any problems for us. It was comfortable and we slept well. As some others have noted, the breakfast is a little sparse in its options, but the food that is available is quite nice. If you aren't impressed, there's a Carrefour market 2 minutes away. The room must be quite nice in summer when they open the windows etc. The receptionist was helpful, allowing us to store our bags for free on our last day whilst we went for a bit of souvenir shopping/sight seeing. There's also a single computer for quickly checking emails etc for free, and Wifi is available through a hotspot (€6 for 3 hours if I remember correctly?). I wouldn't have called the star a 4* hotel, probably a good 3* one, but it was pleasant nonetheless. I'd stay here again when in Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Not 4 star, it's a budget hotel outside city center”
Reviews.Author: Opiemagnum
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 2 nights with contiki tour - this hotel is almost exclusively for contiki groups. Rooms are clean but not 4 star. They define 4 star as a room with ac, attached bathroom and bidet. It's about 16 euro for taxi ride into main city center as this is in a residential area.

Reviews.Title: “Where was the roof garden restaurant?”
Reviews.Author: 190745Vida
Reviews.Content: The roof garden in the brochure does not exist. There are no beautiful views to be had in the breakfast room (you can't see out) just chairs in poor condition and a really bad breakfast. Nescafe coffee and a poor selection of food My room was on the ground floor and had kitchen hobs in the wardrobe, a broken chair to match the broken television, mould on the walls, glue on the bathroom tiles and no plug. The room was hot and noisy and thoroughly depressing with no pictures on the walls whatsoever. The staff were sullen and the lounge TV was in french. Who gave this hotel 4 stars? what a joke.

Reviews.Title: “An average hotel for those on a budget”
Reviews.Author: samuel295
Reviews.Content: We chose this hotel as it was a bargain and was offering very competitively priced winter breaks. The rooms are an excellent size with a small bathroom, although not the cleanest. That said the bed linen was clean and the duvets and pillows appeared new. On the first night we stayed in the hotel with a coachload of 18 year olds on a tour who played football very noisily until the early hours of the morning. The breakfast was OK (no fresh fruit or fresh fruit juice). The main drawback is that the hotel is a long way out of the city (10 minutes from the tube station Furio Camillo on Line A) but there is a bus-stop 50 yards away for the more adventurous (need to change buses to get into the centre though). The service in the hotel was OK -- we were helped to book a taxi to the airport and advised about the public transport strike in good time. The rooms had a small two ring hob in one of the wardrobes but no pans/kettle/coffee & tea/mugs/spoons etc so it was unusable! The hotel does have a small amount of free secure parking but no garden that I could see (a small patch of grass with a bench only)

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, great value!”
Reviews.Author: thrh21982
Reviews.Content: Great hotel. Very nice rooms AND includes secured parking on site.

Reviews.Title: “horrible”
Reviews.Author: MIARUS
Reviews.Content: just returned from the roma park hotel nowhere near 4 star just about scrapes 3 star. first words the receptionist greeted us with upon our arrival was wait!! we had to wait 3 hours for the room to be ready so had a walk around the area which was awful. all the carpets in our room and the corridors were stained. bathroom was disgusting with hairs around the sink and in the shower. shower was tiny and mouldy, shower doors were hanging off. i didnt take my hairdryer as it stated there was one in the room.... what a joke the pipe had all fell apart so no air was coming out at the other end, couldn't dry my hair all weekend. breakfast another joke, had to ask for more orange juice or more bread absolutely rubbish. all reception staff were rude. the bar a complete joke.

Reviews.Title: “I recommend it”
Reviews.Author: JZsuzsa
Reviews.Content: We spent 3 nights in this hotel, and altogether we were very satisfied. The location of the hotel is not central, (probably that's why it is cheaper) but it's not in the suburbs, and it is very easy to reach there: 10 minutes walk to metro station (Furio Camillo - 6 stations away from the Termini railway station) or there's a bus stop right next to the hotel (bus line 628), which takes you to Piazza Venezia and further. There's a supermarket, bread shop and a special italian food-shop near. The hotel itself may not be 4-star, but they are certainly trying. The room is cleaned every day, the towels are changed every day. The bath tube was a bit moldy, but it was clean anyway. (I always bring cleaning tissues with me and do the cleaning myself, but there was not much to do there actually... :-) The room was spacious and comfortable, it was overlooking the huge park in front of the building. It think we got one of the best rooms (room no. 312) on the third floor with a kingsized bed. The breakfast was buffet-type, it was correct, maybe not that wide variety (one type of ham, cheese, bread, croissant, butter, boiled eggs, jam, yoghurt, coffee, tea, milk) but you can eat as much as you want to. The staff was ok, however we didn't need too much help, but they can help you for sure, they speak good English. If you arrive too early, you can't go to your room, but they can keep you luggage there. All in all: if you have luxury needs, this may not be the perfect one for you, but if you want to stay in a nice, clean, modern hotel for your sigthseeing trip, then I really recommend it, because the price is much more lower than the hotels in the central with much worse quality!!!

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel”
Reviews.Author: Pip182
Reviews.Content: We stayed here on Contiki tour. It was a nice clean hotel. Wouldn't get 4 stars in Australia, but it was one of the better ones we stayed in around Europe. THe room was small, so was the bathroom, but did exactly what we needed it for, was to sleep and wash. A fair trek to the metro, on only a slight up hill, but not even noticed this really. We went peak hour on the metro, well I assume it was, it was bit scary as we were told beware of pickpockets. You are literally chest to chest with people!!! Anyway breakfast at hotel was fine, had a dinner there, and it was nice enough. Overall comfy bed, and clean facilities, but really out of the main sight seeing places.

Reviews.Title: “Stay away from Roma Park ~ pay a little more and stay by city center”
Reviews.Author: TravelWiz88
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel as it was part of our tour package with Contiki. When we first arrived around 11:30am, Francesca at the front desk gave one of our friends his room key, but told my boyfriend and me that our room was not ready and we would have to wait for about an hour to get our hotel room. We asked her if she could just put us in a room that was ready and she rolled her eyes and said that it would not be a long wait as it will be ready in about 15 minutes. After 30 minutes went by, I asked her if the room was ready as more than 15 minutes went by, and she told us that it would be another 5 minutes. Long story short, she scolded me after asking her the 3rd time and said, "This is Italy, we do things differently here than America." And finally, after waiting an hour and a half, we were given our room key for room #101. Our hotel room was horrible: stains in the lamp shades, stains in the carpet, mold in the shower, open windows where you can hear all the cars go by on the street, it was hot in the room and the AC unit was not working, and there was a large dent in the middle of one of the beds, and a small dent in the second bed. When I told Francesca about the dents, she said someone will be at my room to fix the problem. The maintenance guy brought in a wooden plank to put under the matress. This did make the dent seem smaller, but the mattress was horribly dented itself and a wooden plank was not going to fix it. After much begging to switch rooms, and some muttered Italian from the maid and Francesca, they switched us to room 201 (right above the old room). The beds in 201 did not have dents and the air conditioning was working, but the toilet seat was cracked, shower had mold, and there were stains on the carpet, walls, and lamp shades as well. This hotel also has a bad location. It was a hike uphill to get to the Metro. Someone who wrote a review said it is a 10 minute walk... however, I walk fast and it took at least 16 minutes to get there. Once you are at the station, it takes about another 20 minutes train ride to get to places of interest in Rome. With so much to see in Rome, if it is your first time to see the city, it is well worth it to stay closer to the city center. I would not recommend this hotel to anyone! I don't know how this hotel got 4 stars (maybe there are some rooms that have been better kept ~ one out of our many Contiki travel friends liked her room), but it was definitely not deserving of any stars with its bad location, rooms in bad condition, and rude service from Francesca (at the front desk). A motel in the USA would have been better than this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Good budget hotel”
Reviews.Author: emilymcgovern
Reviews.Content: Me and my boyfriend (in our 20's) stayed at the Roma Park Hotel for a long weekend and enjoyed our stay. I will be honest, if you are not on a budget or are looking for a 'lovely' hotel, then this hotel probably isn't for you but as a young couple wanting an inexpensive trip, it suited us fine - don't expect too much though. Firstly, we got a taxi from the airport (Ciampino) which cost us 50Euro. We did feel that this was expensive as it wasn't a long journey but apparently that is what is expected. The hotel is in a slightly run down area but i didn't feel it necessary to spend time there as we were staying at the hotel as it was cheaper than the city centre ones. It felt perfectly safe. The hotel itself was pleasant. It was in need of a lick of paint etc but if you're not planning on spending that long in the hotel, i don't see the problem. The bed was comfy, the shower was great and the staff were friendly and helpful. I wasn't too impressed with the breakfast mind - tinned fruit and watered down juice (there were other options but i'm not a great breakfast person myself). On the Saturday, we caught the bus into the centre which was a bit confusing and took about 25-30 mins (bus stop 1 min from hotel). Firstly, you have to book tickets in a newsagents (REMEMBER: buy Sunday tickets beforehand as the newsagents are not always open - recommend buying in bulk). We didn't find it very clear where to get off the bus but a kind man helped us on our way. On the Sunday, we caught the tube (as we didn't have bus tickets). The hotel staff told us that they would not recommend walking to the tube station as it is uphill but i disagree completely. It was a 5-10 minute walk on a small hill. If you are healthy, it is not a problem at all. I preferred catching the tube, i found it more relaxed than the bus. Had a great time in Rome, seeing the sights, eating in lovely restaraunts and altogether enjoying the atmosphere.

Reviews.Title: “Non even acceptable as a three star hotel!”
Reviews.Author: TorinoDalibor
Reviews.Content: The only pro I can think of is the free parking. Lots of cons: no room service available after 10 a.m., awful breakfast in a claustrophobic and hot "roof garden", no air condition till June, small and noisy rooms, dusty unpleasant furniture, dirty bathroom... I stop here. Ah, and the "garden"?

Reviews.Title: “Good to spend the night.”
Reviews.Author: RockieT
Reviews.Content: The rooms and bathroom were comfortable enough. The fourth floor that they call a restaurant isn't worth visiting. Grab a snack from the supermarket on your way into town in the morning, and don't return to the hotel hungry. Easy enough to get into town from. One suggestion, take a walk one morning to the catacombs, 1,200 m from the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Shame about the manners”
Reviews.Author: JanZyl26
Reviews.Content: Just had 3 nights at the Roma Park in Rome. Overall we enjoyed ourselves, however the hotel left a little to be desired. The walls in the bathroom were not of a good standard with mould on the shower etc. The room itself was very nice, a nice size and nice furnishings, for some reason there is a small kitchenette enclosed in part of the wardrobe which is not usable. Our biggest disappointment was the staff, or should I say the reception staff. They were really quite ignorant and rude and we were nothing but polite to them. We only had a drink at the bar once (which was manned by the reception staff) and it was after we had been out for a meal and thought we would have a warm drink in the lounge. My mother asked for a hot chocolate and the guy just said NO I don't do chocolate, i will make you a coffee and that's it. When we left he never said thank you (even though we did) and never wished us a pleasant journey or anything at all. Just rude and with no just cause. We enjoyed Rome and if you are just looking for a base whilst you get around sight seeing as we were it will suffice, however I do not think the service or the bathrooms warrant a 4 star status.

Reviews.Title: “No way is this a 4* - In urgent need of review!”
Reviews.Author: Emmarodber
Reviews.Content: When we arrived, we were concerned about the location as the neigbourhood looked a little dodgey. None the less we thought we would give it the benefit of the doubt. The security was excellent but I was very concerned as to why the owners had gone to such extremes to protect the hotel. Even so, this must be seen as a positive on their part. The hotel lobby was quite stylish, however the bar consisted of three stalls and was only manned if the receptionist was free, otherwise forget it. When arriving in our rooms we found them to be clean. The shower was a little mouldy but I have seen worse. You cannot fault the work of the maids as they ensured the room was spotless every day. We were quite disappointed to see no tea or coffee making facilities but put that down to a cultural difference. We were astounded, however, to see two cooking hobs yet no utensils or pans to actually cook with! There was a fridge which was partially stocked and a mini-safe. The room came equiped with Sky TV which was extremly useful during the recent terrorist scare which occured on our last day. The staff at the hotel could not be bothered to help us at all. One such example is when we needed to borrow an iron. We were told that the hotel only had one and it had already been borrowed by another room. If we wanted it, we had to knock and ask for it ourselves. On our first night we were tired and hungry and just wanted a pizza delivered to our room (there was no where to go nearby and no food is served other than at breakfast time). The receptionist was less than helpful and we struggled for 20 minutes to be understood by the pizza parlour. By the end of the trip I made a point of not even speaking to the Receptionist staff. From the moment we arrived we felt as though we had offended them in some way and that they couldn't be bothered with us so I made a point of not going to them for anything. The breakfast room was ok but very hot in the mornings. It was more on par with 2* then 4*, to be honest. The location was poor, there is no basic welcome information in the room other than a poor marketing leaflet and the reception staff try to push an excursion brochure on you from the moment you enter, which is extremly expensive. At this hotel and as a first time visitor to Rome, you really do feel like a stranger and completly out of your depth. It's hardly a warm welcome. I would recommend that someone look seriously at regrading this hotel as it doesn't deserve 4*'s in my opinion!

Reviews.Title: “Not a four star by any stretch !”
Reviews.Author: Sosider
Reviews.Content: This hotel staff tried but couldn't make this property worth any more than a two star. Air conditioning could not be turned on in mid May in the rooms but the lobby was nicely cooled . The location was not close to anything and the neighborhood was questionable. We were gratefull for the locked gate to the property. Rooms were adequate but nothing that I would recommend.

Reviews.Title: “DEFINITELY not 4*”
Reviews.Author: EdinTraveller
Reviews.Content: This hotel would like to be a 4* but simply isn't. We were booked in for 3 nights but ended up leaving after just 1. We started in room 104 which at best was 2* star quality. It was a reasonable size but was not in good condition. This included blue ink stains spattered up one wall and two cooking rings in one of the cupboards (!!) in addition to wires hanging down from the top. Furthermore the walls were thin - I could hear the guy in the next room shaving in the morning - and our room was at the back looking straight onto the road. Apart from a lumpy bed it was the traffic zooming past all night that kept me awake. The main reason we left though is that my wife is sensitive to dust and within minutes of walking into the room she had a streaming nose and a tight chest. I asked to move rooms but the hotel was full the first night - the staff advised me to check again the next day. On doing this they showed us a room around the corner at the front of the hotel which was nicer. The room had wood laminate rather than carpet - which cut down on the dust and was in better decorative condition at least - probably closer to 3* in quality. It also had a view across the green fields in front of the hotel. By this stage however they had started repainting the main lobby which added paint fumes to the mix. So having weighed it all up and given that we were in Rome for a holiday we decided to cut our losses and move location. Obviously this hotel has some nicer rooms and some not very good rooms and unless you can get one of the better ones you will probably not want to stay here. Location wise the hotel is a few km's south of the historic centre. It is a 10 minute walk to the Furio Camillo metro station which is a few stops from the central Termini station and takes about 5 minutes. There is also a bus service (the 628) which runs right past the hotel and heads on towards Piazza Navona. There is a small supermarket less than 5 mins from the hotel on route to Furio Camillo which is handy for stocking up on food/drink. Further up Via Cesare Baronio towards Furio Camillo there is also an internet cafe - useful if you decide you want to switch hotel and need to find an alternative!! Can't comment on breakfast as our lack of sleep caused us to miss it.

Reviews.Title: “Not quite 4*”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: bit disapointing - rooms was clean but in need of redecoration (i.e. slightly mouldy shower) but otherwise a decent cheap hotel and the staff were very friendly whilst its a good value cheap hotel - felt like it had been oversold a bit - buy stating its four star when its definatley not and the breakfast was poor in selection. on a good note there are some great restuarants locally - for great food and atmosphere at over half the price of what you'd pay int he centre - if you stay her ego to the Restaurante Sud Americano (hotel will direct you!) and make sure you have a map - whilst only 15 mins walk to metro - v easy to get lost!!

Reviews.Title: “Inexpensive and Quite Manageable”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We are a heterosexual couple in our mid 50's who recently stayed at the Roma Park Hotel. We always book inexpensive 2 and 3 star hotels when traveling. We would rate this hotel a nice 3 star. Our very clean room was good size with 2 twin beds, TV, and a desk/chair. A kitchenette including sink, 2 burner stove (no cooking utensils), and minibar frig(room enough to put your own drinks into) was built into a cabinet. There was also a wardrobe closet. All built ins were hidden by cabinet doors. Our private bath included a bidet and shower (no tub). Bath towels were large and thick. We saw men repairing the air conditioning system which was not working our entire 7 day stay. Bedroom windows opened but you could latch the shutters over the open windows for privacy and safety. The elevator was small but adequate for two people and luggage. Breakfast buffets included ham, cheese, hardboiled eggs along with the usual juices, cereals, fruits. and rolls. Its dining area was clean, pleasant, and spacious. We were charged 12 cents per local telephone call, however if you wanted to order pizza delivery the desk clerk will do so for you and not charge you for the call (go down to the desk with your request). There is a grocery store a couple blocks from the hotel where you can also buy beer and wine. Yes, the location isn't the greatest but very managable and safe. Two different bus lines can be caught around the corner from the hotel (bus stop called Macedoni), avoiding a 20 minute uphill walk to the nearest Metro (subway) stop which is Furio Camillo. Rather, take bus #665 towards the San Giovanni bus stop. Get off there and walk half way around the church to find the Metro stop also called San Giovanni (Line A) and proceed on the subway to your destination. Bus line #628, also caught on the Macedonia bus stop around the corner of the hotel, will take you directly into the city center where you can easily walk to its attractions. Try to avoid riding the bus or Metro when the locals are taveling to/from work, it is extemely crowded. A transpotation ticket can be purchased at the tobacco shop near the hotel or in many other locations. One costs .75 euros, about a $1, and can be used on both the bus and Metro (subway) lines for as many times as you want during a 75 minute time period once it is validated. We bought a weekly pass which was good for 7 consecutive days and cost about $15. One early evening we rode the entire route 628 for a pleasant and inexpensive outing (took about 2 hours). It took us along the Tiber, past many city center attractions and ruins, and through several different neighborhoods. There is a shuttle service which the desk clerk can arrange for you to the airport. The cost was 48 euros for up to 4 people. We really got a good pricing deal for staying 7 nights at the Roma Park and found it quite pleasant and more than adequate.

Reviews.Title: “Ick! Bad Location”
Reviews.Author: KBoogie
Reviews.Content: If you are visiting Rome, go to Rome -- not this hotel. True, the hotel is decent, but the location is not near anything. You can find another hotel within walking distance to all the attractions for around the same price (try the Venere web site). The area around the hotel is bad. True, you can take the metro right into the city . . .but why? Why do all that hassle when you can be right in Rome? From this hotel, it is a 10 minute (confusing) walk to the metro, and then another 5 stops at least to any attractions. And if you want to stay out at night, you cannot take the metro back to the hotel, so you will pay $$ for the taxi. If you are trying to save money, consider the transportation costs involved. You will probably make it up. How can you enjoy Rome when you have to make your way back to the boonies at night to sleep? Go to Rome and stay in Rome. I was on a tour, so I had no choice for the hotel, but after my stay here, I then switched hotels, for the same price, to a hotel within walking distance to trevi fountain, spanish steps, etc, etc, and it was just as nice (Hotel Embassy). I would not recommend this hotel to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Turn down the neighbours!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: This hotel comes no where near the 4 star rating it has. There was a mini bar (with 2 cans of sprite inside!), the cooked breakfast promised, turned out to be a substandard continental breakfast with the worst coffee I have ever had and tepid water should you want to attempt tea instead. We went in october which was hot during the day and cold at night, the air conditioning didnt work which meant opening the window. This was an extremely noisy option. The locals seem to have no regard for any neighbours and we once woke to find our selves breathing in petrol fumes from the Italian equivelant of a boyracer/Chav meeting just outside! When it did turn cold there was nothing more than a sheet and a very thin bed spread to keep us warm. There are no tea/coffee making facilities in the rooms. And even though you might think that the San Giovanni area is quite close to the centre its bigger than you think. The nearest tube is Camillo Fumillo (do not let the stupid Tourist information guides tell you San Giovanni), and even then its a 10 min walk and not that pleasant at night. The give away that the area is a problem is compounded by the fact that you might mistake the hotel for a high security prison. My tip...If you can afford to, stay somewhere else.

Reviews.Title: “Agreed, Nice Hotel, Bad Location”
Reviews.Author: Coonometer
Reviews.Content: The hotel was ok, I definitely do not agree with a 4 star rating as some of the carpets were stained and dirty. The staff were very friendly though. The neighbourhood leaves something to be desired and it is a brisk 10 minute walk to the nearest metro station. I felt a bit apprehensive about going out at night to walk to the metro and I come from Glasgow! If I ever come to Rome again it will not be to stay at this hotel.

HotelInfo.Name: Roma Park
HotelInfo.Address: Via della Caffarelletta 114, 00179 Rome, Italy
